description: The cause of CVE-2023-6351 is a use-after-free vulnerability in the libavif library, which is part of the Chromium open-source project. This condition allows memory that is no longer in use to be accessed, leading to potential exploitation by malicious entities. The affected products include Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) builds 119.0.2151.97 and 118.0.2088.122, both of which are mitigated by updating to the fixed versions released on November 29, 2023. The KB Article ID related to this update is KB-119.0.2151.97. It is crucial for administrators to ensure that users are running the latest version of Microsoft Edge to eliminate this security risk.
